basics.description: **Note:** Please refer to the following before installing the solution: • Review the solution [Release Notes](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/tree/master/Solutions/Acronis%20Cyber%20Protect%20Cloud/ReleaseNotes.md) • There may be [known issues](https://aka.ms/sentinelsolutionsknownissues) pertaining to this Solution, please refer to them before installing. The Acronis Cyber Protect Cloud solution for Microsoft Sentinel enables companies to ingest Acronis alerts, events, and activities into Microsoft Sentinel. The data is initially stored on a device on the company network using the Acronis agent as a writer. [See Acronis SIEM Connector documentation here](https://www.acronis.com/en-us/support/documentation/CyberProtectionService/index.html#siem-plans.html) The integration includes custom Acronis detection rules and hunting queries to help companies proactively hunt for threats. **Analytic Rules:** 4, **Hunting Queries:** 13 [Learn more about Microsoft Sentinel](https://aka.ms/azuresentinel) | [Learn more about Solutions](https://aka.ms/azuresentinelsolutionsdoc)

options.text: This solution installs the following analytic rule templates. After installing the solution, create and enable analytic rules in Manage solution view.

elements.name: analytic1
elements.label: Acronis - Login from Abnormal IP - Low Occurrence

options.text: Suspicious login from an IP address observed up to two times in the last two weeks.

elements.name: analytic2
elements.label: Acronis - Multiple Endpoints Accessing Malicious URLs

options.text: Multiple endpoints accessing malicious URLs could indicate an ongoing phishing attack, with several employees interacting with those URLs.

elements.name: analytic3
elements.label: Acronis - Multiple Endpoints Infected by Ransomware

options.text: Detects when three or more distinct endpoints report ransomware detections within a single day.

elements.name: analytic4
elements.label: Acronis - Multiple Inboxes with Malicious Content Detected

options.text: Many inboxes containing malicious content could indicate a potential ongoing phishing attack.
This solution installs the following hunting queries. After installing the solution, run these hunting queries to hunt for threats in Manage solution view.

elements.name: huntingquery1
elements.label: Acronis - Agent failed updating more than twice in a day

options.text: The following devices have failed agent updates more than two times.

elements.name: huntingquery2
elements.label: Acronis - Agents offline for 2 days or more

options.text: Query to find agents that have been offline for two days or longer.
Records user and system operations in the management portal and Cyber Protect console, including scripting, quota, and email archiving events.
Various errors related to S3 or Azure cloud connections.
Multiple endpoints accessing malicious URLs could indicate an ongoing phishing attack, with several employees interacting with those URLs.
A high number of endpoints with multiple incidents could indicate an ongoing attack.

elements.name: huntingquery9
elements.label: Acronis - Endpoints with high failed login attempts

options.text: Multiple endpoints with a high number of failed login attempts could indicate a password spraying attack, where an attacker tries different credentials across several machines.
Many inboxes containing malicious content could indicate a potential ongoing phishing attack.

elements.name: huntingquery11
elements.label: Acronis - Login from Abnormal IP - Low Occurrence

options.text: Suspicious login from an IP address observed up to two times.
Various errors related to Active Protection or CPS malfunctions.

elements.name: huntingquery13
elements.label: Acronis - ASZ defence: Unauthorized operation is detected and blocked

options.text: An attempt to modify the protected Acronis Secure Zone partition was blocked.
